intro: Dryandra ionthocarpa, commonly known as the narrow-leaf dryandra, is a species of flowering plant in the family Proteaceae. It is native to the southwestern region of Western Australia, where it typically grows in sandy soils. The plant is characterized by its narrow, leathery leaves and clusters of small, pale yellow flowers. It is a shrub that can reach heights of up to 2 meters, and it is adapted to the dry, Mediterranean climate of its native habitat. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological significance in the region.
